title: Question re: deptype='run' and `spack install <insert name of x11 font>`
body:
I'm confused about what the 'run' deptype does.

I'm trying to `spack install font-adobe-75dpi`.  The font `depends_on('mkfontdir', type='build')`, which in turn `depends_on('mkfontscale', type='run')`.

`spack install font-adobe-75dpi` fails, the interesting bit of `spack-build.out` is:

```
[...]
make[2]: Entering directory `/tmp/hartzelg/spack-stage/spack-stage-GSXFJq/font-adobe-75dpi-1.0.3'
/rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/mkfontdir-1.0.7-zcq774jm3vq4ockjac5ewmzksh2kt7mm/bin/mkfontdir /rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/font-util-1.3.1-6rs7qlybxshfpui546rmxoeuxkahypbv/share/fonts/X11/75dpi
/rss/spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-5.4.0/mkfontdir-1.0.7-zcq774jm3vq4ockjac5ewmzksh2kt7mm/bin/mkfontdir: line 5: exec: mkfontscale: not found
[...]
```

If I `module load mkfontscale` then the install completes.

While digging around, I confused myself even further.

I added a `depends_on('mkfontscale', type='build')` to the `font-adobe-75dpi` package and was surprised to find that when I `spack env font-adobe-75dpi` I did not have `mkfontscale` available on my path.

With that dependency added to font-adobe-75dpi, `spack spec font-adobe-75dpi` shows `mkfontscale` as a dependency of `mkfontdir`, but **not** of `font-adobe-75dpi`.

If I comment out `mkfontdir`'s dependency on `mkfontscale` and leave the one in `font-adobe-75dpi`, then the spec shows what I "want" and I can install the font.

It seems that if I want to install the X fonts, I need to install mkfontdir and mkfontscale, stop, arrange for mkfontscale to be on my path, then pick up where I left off.

@adamjstewart -- How did you install these things?

Have I stumbled on a known foible?
